snippet: The Frick Collection will announce on Tuesday plans for a new six-story wing, a project that will require the approval of city landmark officials and is likely to draw scrutiny from some of the museum’s neighbors.
abstract: Frick Collection, known for its intimate, jewel-box galleries, will announce plans for a new six-story wing that will increase its exhibition space, open private upstairs rooms, and offer views of Central Park from new roof garden; project will require approval of city landmark officials, and has yet to be presented to Frick's Upper East Side neighbors; it joins roster of museums across country that are enlarging.
lead_paragraph: The Frick Collection will announce on Tuesday plans for a new six-story wing, a project that will require the approval of city landmark officials and is likely to draw scrutiny from some of the museum’s neighbors.

headline.main: Frick Seeks to Expand Beyond Jewel-Box Spaces
headline.print_headline: Frick Seeks to Expand Beyond Jewel-Box Spaces
